#summary What is Disk Arbitration, and why you should care

= Introduction =

FUSE lives down deep at the Darwin kernel level, but needs to interact with the Core File Manager. It does so by talking to a framework called Disk Arbitration. It works well most of the time, but there are still issues with the current build.

= Details =

== A Paranoid KEXT ==

FUSE lives a very tricky life and has to be accordingly paranoid. While it lives in the kernel, it implements a filesystem described by a process in userland. This requires from FUSE a decent level of paranoia. What if the userland daemon isn't ready yet? What if it's crashed?
